channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10541] Make the file system properties customizable per table/column family
item.description: The file system properties like replication (the number of nodes to which the hfile needs to be replicated), block size need to be customizable per table/column family. This is important especially in the testing scenarios or for test tables where we don't want the hfile to be replicated 3 times.
item.summary: Make the file system properties customizable per table/column family

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: FSUtils.create method doesn't honor the permissions passed to it if the file system is a DistributedFileSystem. It uses FsPermission.getDefault(). Not sure if this is intended. But fixing this issue too in this patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12629098

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

This message is automatically generated.

+   * Configuration key for setting the number of nodes to while hfile would be

+   * replicated. This can set at the table or the column family level.

'to while hfile': while -> which.
'This can set': This can be set


+    String value = getValue(HFILE_FS_REPLICATION);

+    return value == null ? -1 : Short.valueOf(value);

How was the default value of -1 determined ?

TestTableFSProperties needs license.


+  private static final String TABLE_NAME_REPLICATION = "testTableReplication";

nit: testTableReplication -> testTableWithCustomReplication

How is FS_BLOCKSIZE different from BLOCKSIZE we already have in HColumnDescriptor Vasu Mariyala?

The FS_ prefix would seem to indicate these settings would work for any filesystem implementation but is that true? Do they only work for HDFS? If so, should they have the HDFS_ prefix instead?

Maybe say where the buffer is located so it is more clear what is being sized in below javadoc:

+ /** Set the amount of data that needs to be buffered during read/write operations. */

... or rename the variables from FS_BLOCKSIZE to HFILE_HDFS_BLOCKSIZE so there can be no mistake.

Otherwise patch looks good. Thanks for working on this.

Thanks stack for the review.

The patch is intended to work for the file systems which honor the properties passed to it using the method


  public FSDataOutputStream create(Path file, FsPermission permission,

      boolean overwrite, int bufferSize,

      short replication, long blockSize, Progressable progress)

Some of the file system implementations like FTPFileSystem, S3FileSystem don't honor the parameters that don't make sense to them. In this example, they don't honor the replication. WebHdfsFileSystem honors all these parameters.

Based on going through the code, the existing BLOCKSIZE of the HColumnDescriptor indicates the size of the Blocks in HFile (Data block, meta block) while the FS_BLOCKSIZE is the block size used by the file system while storing this HFile. Please correct me.

Added more documentation to the rev3.patch
